qas.question: What is the name of the plateau that lies west of the Rocky Mountains?
What is the name of the large southern portion of the Intermontane Plateaus?
What type of flats compose the Great Basin?
What region is centered around the Four Corners?
What is the name of the plateau that lies east of the Rocky Mountains?
A large semi arid desert lies between Rockies and what?
The large northern portion is known as what?
The South East is predominantly what?

context: West of the Rocky Mountains lies the <a0_0><b4_0>Intermontane Plateaus<b4_0/><a0_0/> (also known as the Intermountain West), a large, arid desert lying between the Rockies and <b5_0>the Cascades<b5_0/> and Sierra Nevada ranges. The large southern portion, known as <a1_0>the <b6_0>Great Basin<a1_0/>,<b6_0/> consists of <a2_0>salt flats<a2_0/>, drainage basins, and many small north-south mountain ranges. The Southwest is predominantly <b7_0>a low-lying desert region<b7_0/>. A portion known as the <a3_0>Colorado Plateau<a3_0/>, centered around the Four Corners region, is considered to have some of the most spectacular scenery in the world. It is accentuated in such national parks as Grand Canyon, Arches, Mesa Verde National Park and Bryce Canyon, among others. Other smaller Intermontane areas include the Columbia Plateau covering eastern Washington, western Idaho and northeast Oregon and the Snake River Plain in Southern Idaho.
